message.content:
<<<api>>>: RandomAccessFile.readFully
<<<code>>>: {
    RandomAccessFile file = new RandomAccessFile("test.dat", "rwd");
    int account = file.readInt();
    byte b1[] = new byte[15];
    file.readFully(b1);
    String firstName = new String(b1, 0);
    firstName = firstName.trim();
    byte b2[] = new byte[15];
    file.readFully(b2);
    String lastName = new String(b2, 0);
    lastName = lastName.trim();
    double balance = file.readDouble();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The readFully method reads b1.length bytes from this file into the byte array, starting at the current file pointer. This method blocks until all requested bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown. 

In your code, the first readFully reads 15 bytes into b1, and the file pointer advances by 15. Then, the second readFully reads the next 15 bytes into b2, and the file pointer advances by 15 again. Therefore, the two readFully calls read different parts of the file, and they don't give the same value.

The length of each value (firstname, lastname etc) is not guessed, but determined by the size of the byte array passed to readFully. In your code, both firstname and lastname are read as 15 bytes. If the actual length of the names is less than 15, the remaining bytes will be filled with spaces (if the file was written with writeChars or similar method). If the actual length is more than 15, the names will be truncated.
